paragraphs.text: It’s not about the money, not really. It’s about the arrogance of publications who think I should be happy to do work they can profit from without any profit for myself. It’s as if they are saying:
paragraphs.name: cb04

paragraphs.text: I live on Social Security, $1205 per month. If I’d been paid one dollar for every read I’ve had on Medium I’d be (in my life) rich. Of course, that is not in the stars.
paragraphs.name: 5fbe

cd04c25b0634.title: Yes: I get lots of “offers” to write an article for some site or other for free.

paragraphs.text: Yes: I get lots of “offers” to write an article for some site or other for free. Sometimes I do get a paying offer but it usually doesn't pay much. In those cases I copy in an old article I had written, and tweak it a bit to suit the new platform.
paragraphs.name: a6d9

c0c807c9ff63.title: Well I can tell you that poetry got piddling to nothing before the Internet, so the Internet…

paragraphs.text: Well I can tell you that poetry got piddling to nothing before the Internet, so the Internet certainly didn't cause that.
paragraphs.name: a4be

paragraphs.text: That’s so disrespectful. When I write for free on here, it is for my own enjoyment and because I think I have something to offer. It’s a lot of work and time and care, so if anyone wants me to write for them, I want something in return. Our work is valuable! Good for you for insisting on compensation (and I hope the next person to offer gets it).
paragraphs.name: 8a66

5790173dd1cc.title: Since content replaced writing, that is the brave, new world we live in.

paragraphs.text: Since content replaced writing, that is the brave, new world we live in.
paragraphs.name: 0fe4

5b6a34abe16c.title: It’s an interesting idea, but I know nothing of Youtube other than looking up the odd song.

paragraphs.text: It’s an interesting idea, but I know nothing of Youtube other than looking up the odd song. Nor do I know how to record sound on a computer. I’ll look into it. I am currently dying of boredom and poverty. Learning a new trade might be just the thing. Thanks.
paragraphs.name: 33a1

paragraphs.text: All true.
That is absolutely correct, Bill.
Question for Medium writers. If you had a platform like medium, and it contained ads and you get a percentage of the ad revenue, would you be interested?
paragraphs.name: 177f

paragraphs.text: You would only get revenue from ads that were clicked on within your article and comments section. Obviously, you wouldn’t get credit if you clicked on your own ads, but…
paragraphs.name: 382a

content.subtitle: You would only get revenue from ads that were clicked on within your article and comments section. Obviously, you wouldn’t get credit if…

virtuals.subtitle: You would only get revenue from ads that were clicked on within your article and comments section. Obviously, you wouldn’t get credit if…

2b3fd2fadcbd.title: It’s a great way to keep people insecure and frightened.

paragraphs.text: It’s a great way to keep people insecure and frightened.
paragraphs.name: ced5

fa6eb78b7cdc.title: Larry: It’s a good question, better put to people who write prose than poets.

paragraphs.text: Larry: It’s a good question, better put to people who write prose than poets. Poets don’t expect to make money. TS Eliot was a bank clerk. Wallace Stevens was an insurance executive. WC Williams was a country doctor.
paragraphs.name: 4fdf

paragraphs.text: But prose writers deserve better. They labor longer and harder. Not that poets don’t work hard, but a…
paragraphs.name: 7eff

content.subtitle: But prose writers deserve better. They labor longer and harder. Not that poets don’t work hard, but a thoughtful, organized, sustained…

virtuals.subtitle: But prose writers deserve better. They labor longer and harder. Not that poets don’t work hard, but a thoughtful, organized, sustained…

paragraphs.text: Totally agree. The “do what you love” economy requires the writer to low-bid (against his/her own interest and value) simply to have his/her work accepted so that someone else can make bank. It’s ridiculous. Clients should be bidding for our skills. Harumph.
paragraphs.name: 5ab0

72e43eb9864f.title: I don’t really expect to be paid for poetry.

paragraphs.text: I don’t really expect to be paid for poetry. That’s rare anywhere. But people who write long pieces of fiction or non-fiction should get something for their efforts if they are worthy. You should only have to practice so long before you get in the game.
paragraphs.name: 95ab

1d59c45e8ccf.title: Personally, I think you should start your own YouTube channel.

paragraphs.text: Personally, I think you should start your own YouTube channel. You could teach lessons- how to do this…. Then you wouldn’t feel so badly when every advertiser wants to put ads on your page for all the people who flock there and you get a bazillion hits. That would be sticking it to “the man” — maybe tell the story of the doctors and the license. Have…

4acacb50c4f4.title: I’m so sick of the arrogance of those working in tech and design telling other creatives — and…

paragraphs.text: I’m so sick of the arrogance of those working in tech and design telling other creatives — and writers, especially — they should produce work for free to get jobs.
paragraphs.name: 538c

paragraphs.text: Bullshit. If someone is going to respect your work, they’ll pay you. And, as I wrote recently, don’t devalue my work by not charging for yours.

content.subtitle: Bullshit. If someone is going to respect your work, they’ll pay you. And, as I wrote recently, don’t devalue my work by not charging for…

virtuals.subtitle: Bullshit. If someone is going to respect your work, they’ll pay you. And, as I wrote recently, don’t devalue my work by not charging for…

fc704f979845.title: Yup, and it’s just part of the ‘new’ Golden Rule: “The ones with the gold make all the rules.”

paragraphs.text: Yup, and it’s just part of the ‘new’ Golden Rule: “The ones with the gold make all the rules.”
paragraphs.name: 77f3

c68b50ec5249.title: Seventeen No’s. To Free Or Not To Free

paragraphs.text: Seventeen No’s. To Free Or Not To Free
paragraphs.name: 760d

paragraphs.text: For those of you who think that writing on Medium will get you other writing offers, I have…
paragraphs.name: 93c1

content.subtitle: For those of you who think that writing on Medium will get you other writing offers, I have good news. It will.

virtuals.subtitle: For those of you who think that writing on Medium will get you other writing offers, I have good news. It will.

5a44a3e1a083.title: It’s starting to become apparent that the whole “sharing economy” (aka, micro-entrepreneurs, gig…

paragraphs.text: It’s starting to become apparent that the whole “sharing economy” (aka, micro-entrepreneurs, gig economy, etc.), ain’t all it’s cracked up to be.
paragraphs.name: fdcc

paragraphs.text: Welcome to the “Sharing Economy” (and abandon hope all ye who enter here…)
paragraphs.name: cacb

content.subtitle: Welcome to the “Sharing Economy” (and abandon hope all ye who enter here…)

virtuals.subtitle: Welcome to the “Sharing Economy” (and abandon hope all ye who enter here…)

78d397f64887.title: If you want to write for money you have to sell your soul basically.

paragraphs.text: If you want to write for money you have to sell your soul basically. I have had a few publications contact me saying — “yes we could publish that but we would need to edit out this part and that part because our readers would be offended.” They wanted to change the whole context of what I had written and turn it into the sort of fluffy PC nonsense…

content.subtitle: But I will not put my name to fluffy PC nonsense.

virtuals.subtitle: But I will not put my name to fluffy PC nonsense.

dbd3322238b6.title: When I used to publish in “mainstream” publications, I made a point of submitting to no one that…

paragraphs.text: When I used to publish in “mainstream” publications, I made a point of submitting to no one that charged a “reading fee.” That is simply highway robbery, and it’s common.
paragraphs.name: 8c17

b06c70c41e15.title: At least they’re not offering to publish it for a fee!!!

paragraphs.text: At least they’re not offering to publish it for a fee!!! I’ve seen that… on a site that promises to find you paid writing jobs.
paragraphs.name: c4ec

85a4852bc367.title: Mike, perhaps you should try to see if someone will pay you for your writing… Then come back and…

paragraphs.text: Mike, perhaps you should try to see if someone will pay you for your writing… Then come back and see if you want to make this same argument.

That doesn’t work for poetry. Very few publications will pay you, even quite a few established, name publications. I have published quite a few poems in them and always got paid in hassle and honor. That’s just how poetry works. I accept it.
But if I wrote non-fiction prose, articles, etc., I wouldn’t do it for free unless I…
paragraphs.name: 6efd

content.subtitle: But if I wrote non-fiction prose, articles, etc., I wouldn’t do it for free unless I was just starting out. Too much effort.

virtuals.subtitle: But if I wrote non-fiction prose, articles, etc., I wouldn’t do it for free unless I was just starting out. Too much effort.

574a2f2b16dd.title: Mike Essig,great write and you have touched upon a topic which is an open secret but nobody wants…

paragraphs.text: Mike Essig,great write and you have touched upon a topic which is an open secret but nobody wants to talk about it.Writing is a very painful activity and is a labor of love with steep valleys and very few mountains in between.First step in writing is always building “reputation” as a writer and “money” only comes after that.
paragraphs.name: cb4b

content.subtitle: Some might argue that ,few writers made it big very fast,but those few can be counted by the fingers of the hand.Rest all have struggled…

virtuals.subtitle: Some might argue that ,few writers made it big very fast,but those few can be counted by the fingers of the hand.Rest all have struggled…
